column4: i have tomacat running on port 8080 and i have to acces my localhost via web. For that i created a dynamic dns account. xxxxx.dyndns.org . How can i access my tomcat project over http ?
do you mean http://xxxx.dyndns.org:8080/
that's because xxxx.dyndns.org is pointing to my router
yes it is. you would probably have to configure the router to forward that port to the server
how can i do that?
depends on your router.
tell me generally speaking.
yes, open it and forward it to the server
forward it to the server? sorry don't understand
sorry i cannot help you more with your router
is not a router problem. i just don't understand what you mean with forward the port to my server. i have already localhost:8080 working in my local pc. do you know what i mean?
yes i know what you mean. you will have to enable a feature called "port forwarding" in your router. how to do it depends on your router
i know do portforwarding in my router. my question is if i just have only to open port 8080
if you don't open the port, you cannot connect to the server... so yes
did you try it from a client outside of the lan?
ask a friend to connect to it, then come back here
thanks it works. last question. localhost:8080 is know the same as xxx.dynds.org:8080 true?
localhost is a self-reference, it means "this computer"
i see. thanks
which bug is that?
joaopinto it is not a bug .... is a BUGGGGG https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/xorg-server/+bug/194214
all the available info is put up on launchpad. keep tracking your bug there.
